lead_paragraph: Right now fall is favoring cool-factor shocks of bright, neon colors. But the spring collections took a different approach, revisiting pretty with pastels that, thankfully, aren't too jejune. Everyone from Ralph Lauren to L'Wren Scott and Diane Von Furstenberg chose to dress women - grown women - in tones of mint, lemony yellow and sorbet pink. Meanwhile, at Marni, Christopher Kane and Rochas classic silhouettes had a retro tinge with swirls of '60s-era daisies. Louis Vuitton delighted in remodeling things like boyish biker jackets in chickadee yellow and Easter egg blue. "I wanted to add another dimension to the neons and thought that washing out some of those vivid colors would add an interesting contrast," says the designer Jill Stuart, whose Art Deco Miami dresses were coated in colors like macaroon pink and sea foam green.
